name: 英語發音（一）
restrict: ◎限本系(含雙主修)修習◎限大一修習
goals: The purpose of this course, designed to help students develop speech clarity, is to intensively and extensively teach and drill students in the fundamentals of acceptable pronunciation, stress, and intonation as spoken in modern North American English.
syllabus:
**English Pronunciation (Fall 2022)**

ENU0281; 10:20-12:10, Thursday 

**Instructor**: Alvin Chen ( 陳正賢)

**Email**: alvinchen@ntnu.edu.tw

**Office Hours** : By appointment

**Course Description:**

            The purpose of this course is to help students improve their pronunciation of the English language as they speak it. With a brief introduction to the nature of English consonant and vowel production, as well as the peculiar characteristics of the supra-segmental features of the language, the course provides students with various kinds of listening and speaking practice. Special focus of the oral/aural practice will be placed on pairs/groups of potentially confusing sounds, linking of sounds across syllable/word boundaries, stress, intonation, rhythm, etc. In addition to classroom drills, 2 big recording assignments will be given in a semester, each with specific target sounds/features for students to work on. It is hoped that through the intensive drills, students may develop their sound awareness, become conscious of their pronunciation problems, and further adopt the most efficient way to solve the problems and improve their pronunciation.

**Textbook:**

Lane, Linda. 2005. _Focus on Pronunciation 3(3rd ed)_. NY: Pearson Education. (Available at師大書苑：2F, No. 182-3, Hoping E. Rd. Taipei, 02-83695558)
